title: Broadstone Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Footpath beside Broadstone Reservoir by Chris Wimbush, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footpath beside Broadstone Reservoir

images.title: Barry Hurst / Broadstone Reservoir
images.caption: Broadstone Reservoir. The view from Birds Nest Lane on the Barnsley Boundary Walk. The skyline has lost the tall turbines of the Wind Farm on this hazy spring day.

images.title: Chris Yeates / Broadstone Reservoir
images.caption: One of several reservoirs in this area; with the wind farm in the background

description: This walk visits Broadstone Reservoir near Barnsley and Huddersfield. The small lake has a nice waterside path with seats to rest and enjoy the view over the water to the surrounding countryside. To extend the walk you can pick up the Barnsley Boundary Walk and follow it east to visit Scout Dike, Royd Moor and Ingbirchworth Reservoirs .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Just to the west there's the worthy village of Hepworth where you'll find the Butcher's Arms. The pub dates back to the early 1800s and is notable for featuring in the long running tv show Last of the Summer Wine. Many scenes from the show were shot around the village with the characters often meeting up in the pub. You can find them at postcode HD9 1TE for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head a few miles to the south west and there's the expansive Winscar Reservoir near Dunford Bridge.

display_address: Broadstone Road, Dunford, Barnsley, South Yorkshire, England, HD8 8YF, United Kingdom
